channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Three Christmas trees, 30th January
item.description:
Abandoned trees on grass verges

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fountayne Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned, untaxed and without MOT vehicle, 30th January
item.description:
This vehicle was abandoned quite some time ago and is not taxed or MOT’d. This has been reported by others and nothing has been done about removing the vehicle. The vehicle has a smashed nearside cab window and the rear nearside door has been prised ajar.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large TV on Seal Street E8 at Shacklewell Row, 30th January
item.description:
Hello, please can you remove the dumped TV which is at Seal Street E8 at Shacklewell Row? Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seal Street, Hackney, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: At bus stop and around, 30th January
item.description:
Quite a lot of litter at this bus stop and around, including behind it. Please could you ask the guys to give this area a thorough cleaning Much obliged
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: First stretch of Cameron Road from Hayes Road needs resurfacing., 30th January
item.description:
The section of Cameron Road, entering from Hayes Road (from No.1) is starting to form multiple linear cracks in the road up to No.13 Cameron Road. This section of road needs to be resurfaced. Buses come along here adding more stress to the road surface. There are now 3 large potholes from Busstop G and near entrance to Stone Road which are getting worse by the week - again busses going along these are making this worse and this is not good for passengers either.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Stone Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle way blocked with no diversion, 30th January
item.description:
There is barely enough room to wheel my bike along the pavement here. The hoardings should be narrowed. The road is often further blocked with construction vehicles and deliveries to the construction site. With the other side street to the East also block navigation for pedestrians is severely constrained - basically it turns into a one way for pedestrians
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Walbrook, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian green not working, 30th January
item.description:
Pedestrian lights don’t turn Green even after pressing button
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Station Road, Longlands, Greater London

item.title: Temporary traffic lights, 30th January
item.description:
These lights have been in place for months. The period on them is too long. They are ignored by traffic due to this. Furthermore I don't know what their purpose is as the usable road width is not decreased by the construction work hoardings.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hobbs Place Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes everywhere, 30th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): York Hill, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Flytipped rubbish, 30th January
item.description:
This flytipping beneath the public footbridge has been there for 2wks so far and makes the path unpassable. It seems to have had things added each time we go to asda via the footbridge and foxes are getting to the rubbish bags and spreading stuff more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road North, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
